Author: Author
Name: Name
ACTOR.Title: Actors Directory
CHAT.FlushWarning:
Are you sure?

All messages within the chat log will be deleted and cleared.
CHAT.Title: Chat Log
COMBAT.NoneRemaining: There are no Combatants remaining in this Encounter which are not defeated.
COMBAT.ResourceHint: Choose an attribute to track for each combatant.
COMBAT.SkipDefeatedHint: Automatically bypass combatants marked as defeated?
COMPENDIUM.Name: Compendium Name
COMPENDIUM.CreateHint: Create a new Compendium pack in your current World.
COMPENDIUM.DuplicateHint: You may duplicate this compendium into your World to have a local copy of its content which is safe to edit.
COMPENDIUM.TypeHint: Each Compendium pack contains a specific type of Entity.
COMPENDIUM.ToggleLockedWarning: You are attempting to unlock for editing a compendium that does not belong to this World. Any changes you make in this compendium pack may be lost if the system or module which owns it is updated. You may wish to duplicate the compendium to your world instead. Do you wish to proceed?
CONTROLS.Title: Game Controls Reference
CONTROLS.Instructions: This form describes common keyboard and mouse commands used to control various aspects of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment. Some controls are only available to a GameMaster user, those are highlighted in light purple.
CONTROLS.FOWResetDesc: This will reset fog of war for this Scene for all players.
CONTROLS.HeaderGameNotes: These controls generally apply across all aspects of Foundry functionality.
CONTROLS.HeaderCanvasNotes: These controls apply when interacting with a specific Canvas layer.
CONTROLS.HeaderObjectsNotes: These controls apply when interacting with an Object placed on the Canvas.
CONTROLS.HeaderSpecialNotes: These controls apply only during specific interactions.
ENTITY.TypeHint: Specify the type of Entity you would like to create
ERROR.ChromiumVersion: Foundry Virtual Tabletop uses modern JavaScript features which are unsupported on Chromium version less than {minimum}. You are using Chromium version {version} and may encounter issues.
ERROR.LowResolution: Foundry Virtual Tabletop requires a minimum screen resolution of {reqWidth}px by {reqHeight}px or greater. Your display currently has an effective resolution of {width}px by {height}px, as a result many features of the software may not work properly.
ERROR.NoWebGL: Your browser does not currently support WebGL rendering which is required by Foundry Virtual Tabletop. Ensure that you have hardware rendering and WebGL enabled in your browser.
ERROR.BackgroundTextureSize: You are using a Scene background texture with dimensions {width}px by {height}px. One or both of these dimensions exceeds the maximum texture size of {max}px supported by your device.
ERROR.InvalidAdminKey: The provided administrator access key is invalid. If you have forgotten your configured password you will need to manually delete the Config/admin.txt file from your user data location.
ERROR.TokenCollide: The attempted Token movement collides with at least one Wall.
WARNING.GridConfigNoBG: You are using the grid configuration tool for a scene with no background image. This is not currently recommended and may produce unpredictable results.
FILES.TileSizeHint: Specify the pixel grid size of source tile artwork so it will be automatically resized when placed onto your active Scene.
FILES.NoResults: No matching results found in this location.
INVITATIONS.Copied: Game invitation link copied to clipboard
INVITATIONS.Instructions: Share the below invitation links with users who you wish to have join your game. The local invitation link is for users on your local network while the internet link connects via internet on the configured port.
INVITATIONS.Title: Game Invitation Links
LIGHT.DarknessThresholdHint: If a darkness threshold is set, this light will be visible only when the Scene darkness level exceeds that threshold.
MACRO.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure? This Macro will be permanently deleted.
MODMANAGE.Title: Module Management
MODMANAGE.Instructions: Use this form to configure which Modules are active within your current World. Submitting changes to active modules will cause the current session to reload.
MODMANAGE.View: The Modules listed below are currently active within this World.
MODMANAGE.None: No Modules are available within this World. You can view, but do not have permission to modify this list.
PLAYERS.Title: Players
SCENES.AccessHint: Control permission to this scene and whether it appears in the navigation bar.
SCENES.AppearanceHint: Configure the background image and dimensions of the scene's primary map.
SCENES.AudioPlaylistHint: A Playlist which should automatically begin playing when this Scene is activated.
SCENES.DarknessHint: Configure a darkness overlay which obscures the Scene to simulate night or dim conditions.
SCENES.FogExploreHint: Track exploration progress in this scene, dispelling fog of war.
SCENES.GlobalIllumHint: Illuminate all areas of the Scene that a controlled Token has line of sight to observe.
SCENES.GridConfigHint: Configure the grid dimensions which are used to measure token movement in this scene.
SCENES.InitialViewHint: Set a default camera position that is displayed the first time this Scene is viewed.
SCENES.NavNameHint: An alternative Scene name that is displayed to players in the Navigation Bar.
SCENES.JournalNotesHint: A linked Journal Entry which provides notes for the Game Master about this Scene.
SCENES.TokenVisionHint: Restrict visibility within this Scene based on controlled Tokens and their vision.
SCENES.WeatherEffectHint: Configure the background image and dimensions of the scene's primary map.
SETTINGS.Title: Configure Game Settings
SETTINGS.LangL: Change the displayed language for Foundry Virtual Tabletop.
SETTINGS.CBubL: Configure whether or not chat bubbles will be displayed above Tokens for in-character and emote type chat messages.
SETTINGS.CBubPL: Configure whether to automatically pan the camera to a speaking token when it displays a chat bubble.
SETTINGS.MaxFPSL: Limit the maximum framerate at which Foundry Virtual Tabletop will render canvas updates. Lowering this value may improve application performance for less powerful hardware.
SETTINGS.SoftSL: Enable soft shadows for more beautiful dynamic lighting, or disable it for improved performance on machines with lower-end hardware.
SETTINGS.None: There are no settings of this type which you have the ability to configure.
SETUP.CoreVersionHint: If an update to the core Foundry Virtual Tabletop software is available, you may apply it here. You are currently using version {coreVersion}.
SETUP.UpdateAvailable: A software update to {channel} version {version} is now available!
SETUP.ConfigurationWarning: The following attributes customize the behavior of the Foundry Virtual Tabletop server. Be cautious when making changes. You will need to restart the software for these changes to take effect.
SETUP.Title: Configuration and Setup
SETUP.UpdateChannelHint: You may choose an update channel to control the types of updates you wish to receive for the core Foundry Virtual Tabletop software. If you do not have a specific reason to change this, it is recommended to consume the Release channel.
SETUP.ForceUpdateHint: Checking the Force Update box will force your version to the requested channel. Do not use this option unless you know exactly what you are doing.
SETUP.UpdateWarning: In order to update Foundry Virtual Tabletop you will need to be connected to the internet and have a valid software license.
SETUP.InstallHint: You can install any package by providing a direct link to its JSON manifest URL.
SETUP.PackageFilterHint: You can filter available packages, searching by their package name or title
SETUP.AdminKeyHint: You may assign a special administrator password which is required in order to access this setup screen.
SETUP.AWSHint: You may provide an AWS configuration file for S3 integration. The path is absolute or relative to the Config subdirectory of user data.
SETUP.PortHint: You may choose which port Foundry Virtual Tabletop uses for TCP connection traffic and enable or disable Universal Plug and Play (UPnP).
SETUP.DataPathHint: Configure the location where your user data including worlds, systems and modules are stored.
SETUP.WorldHint: You may choose one of your available worlds to automatically launch when the software is started.
SETUP.SSLHint: You may run the server using secure socket layer (SSL) encryption by providing paths to certificate and key files. Paths are absolute or relative to the Config subdirectory in user data.
SHEETS.EntitySheetHint: Override which sheet class you would like to use for this specific entity.
SHEETS.TypeSheetHint: Set the default sheet class used for this entity type (GM Only).
SIDEBAR.DeleteConfirm:
Are you sure?

This entity will be permanently deleted.
FOLDER.DeleteConfirm:
Are you sure?

This folder and its contents will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered.
FOLDER.Name: Folder Name
FOLDER.RemoveConfirm:
Are you sure?

This folder will be deleted and its contents will be moved to a parent folder.
PERMISSION.ConfigureHint: Fine tune the permitted actions which are allowed to Users for each role.
PERMISSION.Title: Permission Configuration
PERMISSION.Instructions: Configure which User role has permission to perform which action. Note that some actions cannot be disabled for Game Master users. Some changes may not take effect until the game is reloaded.
PERMISSION.BroadcastAudioHint: Allow players with this role to broadcast audio when using A/V chat integration.
PERMISSION.BroadcastVideoHint: Allow players with this role to broadcast video when using A/V chat integration.
PERMISSION.ActorCreateHint: Allow players with this role to create new Actors in the World.
PERMISSION.DrawingCreateHint: Allow players with this role to create Drawings using the drawing tools.
PERMISSION.ItemCreateHint: Allow players with this role to create new Items in the World.
PERMISSION.FilesBrowseHint: Allow players with this role to browse through available files in the File Picker.
PERMISSION.FilesUploadHint: Allow players with this role to upload content to the server using the File Picker.
PERMISSION.JournalCreateHint: Allow players with this role to create new Journal Entries in the Journal sidebar.
PERMISSION.MacroScriptHint: Allow players with this role to use JavaScript macros which access the API.
PERMISSION.MessageWhisperHint: Allow players with this role whisper private messages that the Game Master cannot see.
PERMISSION.SettingsModifyHint: Allow players with this role to modify game settings and enable or disable modules.
PERMISSION.ShowCursorHint: Display the position of the player's mouse cursor which illustrates where the user is looking on the canvas.
PERMISSION.TemplateCreateHint: Allow players with this role to create templates for area-of-effect measurement.
PERMISSION.TokenCreateHint: Allow players with this role to place Tokens for Actors they own on the game canvas.
PERMISSION.TokenConfigureHint: Allow players with this role to configure the settings for Tokens that they own.
PERMISSION.WallDoorsHint: Allow players with this role interact with doors defined on the Walls Layer.
TABLE.AnimateSettingHint: Configure whether to display a roulette-style animation when drawing from a Roll Table.
TEMPLATE.ConeTypeSettingHint: Choose how the area of effect for cone templates should be defined.
TOKEN.CharInstructions: Configure which Actor this Token is associated with.
TOKEN.ImageInstructions: Configure the Token image and its displayed size and scale.
TOKEN.PositionInstructions: Configure the Token's position, orientation, and elevation.
TOKEN.ResourceInstructions: Configure the resource bars which are tracked for the Token.
TOKEN.Title: Token Configuration
TOKEN.VisionInstructions: Configure the vision capability and light emission of this Token.
WALLS.Title: Wall Configuration
WALLS.Instructions: Customize how this wall segment restricts movement or senses.
WEBRTC.Title: Audio/Video Configuration
WEBRTC.MenuHint: Configure settings specific to the integrated Audio/Video WebRTC component
WEBRTC.VideoDeviceNotes: Select which video capture device you wish to use, if any.
WEBRTC.AudioDeviceNotes: Select which audio capture device you wish to use, if any.
WEBRTC.AudioOutputNotes: Select which audio output device you wish to use.
WEBRTC.GeneralTabNotGM: General Audio/Video Conferencing Settings can only be modified by the GM
WEBRTC.AVModeNotes: Only a GameMaster user may change this setting, which will require Foundry VTT to reload.
WEBRTC.PTTKeyNotes: Assign a keyboard key which, in PTT mode, enables voice while held. If not in PTT mode, the same key mutes while pressed.
WEBRTC.VoiceModeNotes: Choose how your voice is broadcast in AV calls.
WEBRTC.CaptureWarningVideo: Unable to capture from your Audio devices; Sharing Video only
WEBRTC.CaptureWarningAudio: Unable to capture from your Video devices; Sharing Audio only
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorAudioVideo: Unable to capture from your Audio & Video devices
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorVideo: Unable to capture from your Video devices
WEBRTC.CaptureErrorAudio: Unable to capture from your Audio & Video devices
WEBRTC.ConnectError: Error connection to Audio/Video Signalling Server
WEBRTC.ConnectionLostWarning: Lost connection to the Audio/Video Signalling server. Trying to re-establish connection.
WEBRTC.NoSSLError: You cannot use Audio/Video calls unless your Foundry VTT server is using SSL certificates. See the online documentation for instructions.
